sub_title: Associate Board Member of the Dutch Safety Board, former Director Netherlands Defence Intelligence and Security Service
summary:
Associate board member of the Dutch Safety Board, network associate of Boardroom@Crisis (crisis management and security services), strategic advisor to the Hague Centre for Strategic Studies , Gateway Review Team Leader and intaker and independent consultant. Building on a unique, extensive background in command, management and leadership of (counter)intelligence, security, cyber and Joint/Combined military operations. 

In April 2016 retired as Rear Admiral as Director of the Netherlands Defense Intelligence and Security Service. Serving customers at the cabinet, operational, and tactical level. 

Held several seagoing commands (submarines and surface ships - frigate and amphibious transport ship -) and "Teacher" of the NLD Submarine Command Course before command of the integrated, operational, deployable staff of the Royal Netherlands Navy; “Netherlands Maritime Force (NLMARFOR)”. 

As COMNLMARFOR acted, in succession, as Deputy Maritime Component Commander of the NATO Response Force (NRF), Commander Amphibious Component of the NRF and Force Commander of the EU counter-piracy operation "ATALANTA". 

Amongst shore staff functions were Deputy Director Operational Policy, Naval planner at the Joint staff of the Chief of Defense and analyst at the Submarine Tactics and Weapons Group, Flag Officer Submarines, UK Royal Navy, Scotland.

- Support  informed, “whole of government” decision making on military, foreign affairs, counter terrorism, counter intelligence and cyber domain matters by the Minister of Defence, the Prime Minister and the Ministers of Foreign affairs, Security and Justice, Internal and Kingdom affairs and Economic affairs .
- Support of the Chief of Defence and Dutch deployed units and staffs.
- "Computer Network Exploitation" and other Cyber relevant collection, analyses and exploitation in support of adequate "Cyber Defence" and "Computer Network Attack". 
- Screening of personnel of the Ministry of Defence.
- Certification of and security advice to Defence Related Industry.

- (Re)organised NL DISS to optimise “all source” collection, analyses and exploitation in order to satisfy customer requirements.
- Introduced rescource allocation and Lessons Identified/Lessons Learned processes.
- Optimised cooperation with national partners. In particular with the General Intelligence and Security Service (AIVD) (more joint teams, improved joint reporting, formation of the Joint SIGINT/Cyber Unit, decision to co-locate in a new build, intelligence dedicated, secure building).
- Optimised cooperation with old and new international partners. 
- Contributed to draft new law on Intelligence and Security Services.
- Former Chair of the (BICES) board of Governors (Battlefield Information, Collection, & Exploitation System).', 'title': 'Director Defence Intelligence and Security Service', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': 1640612, 'name': 'Ministry of Defence', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C4D0BAQFVH54KiIdQXw/company-logo_400_400/0/1564994065930?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=E-QE5mD3dGa9XmN6shTmn0zKHSZNHjJhbmnP9zDRXPE', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/company/ministerie-van-defensie/', 'employees': {'start': 10001, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2010}, 'end': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2011}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'The Hague', 'date': {'start': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2010}, 'end': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2011}}, 'company': 'Ministerie van Defensie', 'description': '- Organise and formulate (framework) options for balancing the defence budget.
